title: Library Contract Request: EBSCO Education Research (Delaware Technical Community College)

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Library Contract Request: EBSCO Education Research (Delaware Technical Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with EBSCO relating to the licensing of Education Research;
All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with EBSCO for Education Research database licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of Education Research.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with smhc.

title: Peace Officer Certifications Statewide and Oaths/Bonds for Graves County Officials – Kentucky (Office of the Attorney General - Kentucky)

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Peace Officer Certifications Statewide and Oaths/Bonds for Graves County Officials – Kentucky (Office of the Attorney General - Kentucky)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To whom it may concern,

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act (KRS 61.870 to 61.884), I respectfully request the following public records:

⸻

1. Law Enforcement Certifications (Statewide):
	•	A list of all individuals certified as peace officers in the Commonwealth of Kentucky as of the date of this request.
	•	For each officer: full name, date of birth (or year of birth), employing agency, certification status (active/inactive/expired), certification type (e.g., POPS), issue date, and expiration date.
	•	Please include any notes regarding pre-certification, conditional certification, or decertification.

2. Brady/Giglio Disclosure List (Commonwealth of Kentucky):
	•	A current list of law enforcement officers or public officials who are known to be subject to Brady or Giglio disclosure obligations due to credibility, misconduct, or dishonesty issues.
	•	Please include any officers flagged or designated by prosecutors, the Kentucky State Police, the Kentucky Law Enforcement Council, or the Office of the Attorney General.
	•	If no centralized list exists, please provide any policy or guidance that governs Brady/Giglio reporting within the Commonwealth.

3. Oaths of Office and Official Bonds (Graves County):
	•	Certified copies of the oaths of office and official bonds for all currently serving public officials in Graves County, including:
	•	All deputies, command staff, and elected officials in the Graves County Sheriff’s Office
	•	All Mayfield Police Department officers
	•	All county-level judges and prosecutors
	•	The Graves County Clerk, County Attorney, and all magistrates or county commissioners

This request is submitted in good faith for public accountability and transparency and is specifically intended to confirm the legal authority, certification, and ethical standing of public officials acting within Graves County and the Commonwealth.

I am a resident of Kentucky, and this request is made in accordance with 21-ORD-193 and KRS 61.872(1).

I prefer digital delivery of responsive documents to: pager06@gmail.com. If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me in advance.

Thank you for your time and attention to this request.

Sincerely,
Paige Kathleen Allen
P.O. Box 322
Mayfield, KY 42066
Email: pager06@gmail.com
Phone: (270) 205-1773

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paige Allen

title: BTC Held By US Marshals Service

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: BTC Held By US Marshals Service
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The amount of bitcoin held by the US Marshals Service. 

As an independent journalist, I ask that all fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lola Leetz

communications.subject: JMD FOIA Request 137393 Acknowledgement (Intranet Quorum IMA00175683)
communications.communication:
May 21, 2025  Ms. Lola Leetz  DEPT MR 182298 
MuckRock News 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA 02115-4506  Re: The amount of bitcoin held by the U.S. Marshals Service  Assigned JMD FOIA TRACKING NUMBER: 137393  Dear Ms. Leetz:  This is to acknowledge receipt of your Freedom of Information Act request dated 3/2/2025 and received in this office on 5/21/2025 in which you requested records concerning the subject identified above.  Your request was sent to JMD by the US Marshals Service as a misdirected request. The identifying tracking number was 2025-USMS-001026.  For your information, the Justice Management Division assigns incoming requests to one of three tracks: simple, complex, or expedited. Each request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to other requests in the same track. Simple requests usually receive a response in approximately one month whereas complex requests necessarily take longer. At this time, your request has been assigned to the Complex track. Please note that as a general matter, records in the Department are decentralized and our response will only cover information originating with or relating to JMD. If you are seeking information originating with or relating to other components of the Department, please make a FOIA request directly to those components.  If you have a question about the status of your FOIA request, you may contact this office by emailing JMDFOIA@usdoj.gov or by calling 202-616-0253 during regular business hours (Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., Eastern Time, excluding federal holidays).  Please refer to your assigned JMD FOIA TRACKING NUMBER listed above whenever you contact the Department regarding this request.  Sincerely,  Daniel Wagner FOIA Contact Justice Management Division

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Raleigh Police Department)

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Raleigh Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Archie Smith

title: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting complete military service records for United States Army veteran Thomas J. Kashuba, D.O.B. November 28 1936, who served in the U.S. Army with estimated service from approximately mid-1950s through 1970s. As his grandson conducting family genealogical research, I am seeking his military personnel file and service documentation.

Records requested:

- Official Military Personnel File (OMPF)
- Service record and assignment history
- Military photographs and portraits
- Awards, decorations, and commendations
- Training records and military education
- Unit assignments and duty stations
- Discharge documentation


FAMILY BACKGROUND: My grandfather Tommy, served as an Army equipment/inventory specialist and I was told that he was stationed at a major base in Washington State. I was named after my grandfather (my middle name is Thomas), reflecting the close relationship we had before his passing when I was 11 years old. I have no surviving immediate family contact and possess no military service documentation or even photographs of his career.

GENEALOGICAL PURPOSE: This request serves family heritage preservation and military service legacy documentation.

Fee waiver requested for family genealogical research and military heritage preservation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

communications.subject: Fwd: Freedom of Information Act Request: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Kashuba:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email referral to
foia@nara.gov. We received your request on June 9, 2025.  Your request
concerns the *military service records for United States Army veteran
Thomas J. Kashuba, D.O.B. November 28 1936, who served in the U.S. Army.*

Due to the nature of your inquiry, we are forwarding your request by this
email to the National Personnel Records Center (NPRC) for Military Records
in St. Louis for appropriate handling.  The NPRC will assign your request a
tracking number and respond directly to you.  In the future, if you need to
contact the NPRC, you can do so by mail or fax to the following address:

National Personnel Records Center
1 Archives Drive
St. Louis, Missouri 63138

Telephone:   314-801-0800
Telephone (Toll Free):  1-866-272-6272 (only within the US)
Fax:  314-801-9195

For your reference, below you will find your original submission.

On our website at https://www.archives.gov/veterans/military-service-records
you can find information about requesting Official Military Personnel Files
(OMPFs) that are not yet archival records fully open to the public.  At the
website for the National Archives at St. Louis,
https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/ <https://www.archives.gov/st-louis/%20>,
you will find information about requesting Official Military Personnel
Files that are now archival records open to the public.  The OMPF normally
becomes an archival record 62 years after the date of discharge.

At www.archives.gov/foia <http://www.archives.gov/foia%20> we provide
information about FOIA.  On our home page, www.archives.gov, you can learn
about the resources that we offer to the public, and access our online
catalog.

Sincerely,

<https://www.archives.gov/>

  Ashley Bryan

  Government Information Specialist

  Operational FOIA and Access Division

  College Park, Maryland, 20740-6001

  301-837-3642

   <https://www.archives.gov/foia>   <foia@nara.gov>
<https://www.archives.gov/foia/contacts>
<https://www.archives.gov/foia/electronic-reading-room>
<https://www.archives.gov/ogis/resources>

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Bryan, 

Thank your expeditious and gracious response. My son and I are looking forward to memorializing grandpa Tommy's legacy in both the US Army and Police Career through our records acquisition efforts. 

I would like to bring to your attention that my submission here on Muckrock was directed at the NPRC when I made the request. There is a possibility that the email address was somehow mis-indexed on Muckrock or possibly mis-routed somewhere along the way. I just wanted to bring this to your attention and anyone else that it may benefit. 

Once again please accept my gratitude for your fast and professional response, 

Justin Kashuba

communications.subject: C-0005921493 Request for Military Records
communications.communication:
Hi Justin,

Unfortunately the request that you submitted did not list a contact phone
number so I was not able to reach you.  Your request also did not contain a
mailing address, so I was not able to mail a response letter.  The only
contact information listed in your request is this unusual email address.

I'm sending the only information available based on the extremely limited
information that you provided.  This information is Archival and is
releasable to anyone.

The date of birth does not match but it was only off by one day.  You did
not provide the veteran's Social Security Number, Place of Birth, Date of
Death, Service Number or specific dates of service.

Generally our website is a better option for submitting requests because it
guides you on the information necessary to locate a record-  The link is
listed below for your reference.

https://www.archives.gov/veterans

Thank you,
-- 
Melinda Vaupel
Expert Archives Technician 1D
National Personnel Records Center
1 Archives Drive
St. Louis, MO  63138

Office: (314) 801-0977

Email: Melinda.vaupel@nara.gov

title: Police disciplinary files (Lewis County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Lewis County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Moe Clark

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552, I request all records—paper or electronic—created
or received by FBI Headquarters, the Tampa Field Office, or the Los Angeles
Field Office from 1 Jan 1990 to the present that reference:

 • Church of Scientology International (CSI)
 • Religious Technology Center (RTC)
 • Flag Service Organization (FSO)
 • Flag Ship Service Organization / motor vessel “Freewinds” (FSSO)
 • Sea Organization (“Sea Org”)
 • David Miscavige, Gavin Potter, Valeska Paris, Gawain Baxter,
   Victoria Locke, Chrissie Carnell Bixler, or Danny Masterson

Requested subject matter

   – allegations of sexual assault or child sexual abuse  
   – human trafficking or forced labor (18 U.S.C. §§ 1589–1591)  
   – retaliation, “Fair Game,” obstruction of justice, or witness tampering  
   – use or enforcement of arbitration agreements to suppress reports

Record types

Please search main and cross-reference indices, “Zero Files,” Sentinel,
ACS, ELSUR indices, and any predecessor systems for:

   ● FD-302 witness interviews, lead sheets, case summaries  
   ● Physical-evidence or electronic-surveillance logs  
   ● Referral/declination letters to USAOs or DOJ divisions  
   ● Internal legal memoranda analyzing First-Amendment issues  
   ● Closed investigative files (no pending law-enforcement purpose)

If portions are exempt, please release all reasonably segregable non-exempt
material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chia

title: Thomaston CT Superintendent Evaluation

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Thomaston CT Superintendent Evaluation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Complete 2024-2025 evaluation document of the Superintendent of Schools, including all individual evaluation sections used in the assessment. Include all written commentary included within the document. 
- Scoring or rating by each board member, including any per-section breakdowns.
- Any tabulation documents or score compilations showing how the final average score of 3.81 was calculated. 
- All supporting documentation related to the evaluation process, such as evaluation rubrics or templates used. 
- Any memos, drafts, or other written communications to or from board members regarding the evaluation or evaluation process. 


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Bellford

communications.subject: FOIA Response – Superintendent Evaluation Records (PCI IN-03-576 / MuckRock Request No. 188060)
communications.communication:
To:            Sam Bellford via 188060-94688149@requests.muckrock.com

Dear Mr. Bellford,

This email responds to your Freedom of Information Act request dated June
16, 2025, regarding the 2024–2025 evaluation of the Superintendent of
Schools.

Response to Requested Items
·       Final Evaluation Document: The complete 2024–2025 Superintendent
Evaluation document, including individual evaluation sections and written
commentary, was publicly posted on the Thomaston Board of Education website
as part of the June 9, 2025 Regular Meeting agenda.
·       Scoring or Ratings by Board Members: The Board of Education does
not maintain individual scoring or per-section breakdowns by member. Only
the final, composite evaluation document is maintained.
·       Tabulation or Score Compilation: The rubric and calculation method
used to determine the average score of 3.81 are included in Board Policy
2400, which is posted publicly on the district’s website.
·       Supporting Documentation: No additional templates, forms, or tools
were used beyond what is available within Policy 2400. No further records
exist.
·       Memos or Communications: The district maintains no memos, drafts,
or written communications to or from Board of Education members concerning
the 2024–2025 Superintendent evaluation or its process. Therefore, there
are no responsive records for this item.
·       Format and Fees: As all responsive records are already available
online, no documents are being attached and no fees are assessed for this
response.

This response complies with the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (CGS
§1-200 et seq.). No records have been created or modified for the purpose
of responding to this request.

If you have any further questions, you may contact me directly.

Sincerely,

*Francine Coss*
Superintendent of Schools

*Thomaston Public Schools Mission Statement:*

In a partnership of family, school and community, our mission is to
*educate*, *challenge* and *inspire* each individual to excel and become a
contributing member of society.
*Thomaston Public Schools*
185 Branch Road
Thomaston, CT 06787
Phone: 860-283-3053
Fax: 860-283-3096
www.thomastonschools.org
@ThomastonBOE <https://twitter.com/ThomastonBOE>



*The information contained in this communication may be confidential or
legally privileged and is intended only for the recipient(s) named above.
If the reader of this message is not the intended recipient, you are hereby
notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of this
communication or its contents is strictly prohibited.  If you have received
this communication in error, immediately advise the sender and delete the
original and any copies from your computer system.*

files.title: FOIA Request - dated June 16, 2025
files.source: Board Of Education, Thomaston, CT

communications.subject: RE: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Thomaston CT Superintendent Evaluation
communications.communication:
Superintendent Coss,

Thank you for your response to my FOIA request.

As noted, Board Policy 2400 includes Form 2, which outlines the rubric used to evaluate the superintendent. This form includes 30 questions across several categories and appears to be the basis for the 3.81 aggregate score posted on the district’s website in the June meeting minutes. 

To clarify, can you please confirm whether Form 2 was completed by members of the Board of Education as part of the 2024–2025 evaluation process? If so, I respectfully request copies—draft or final—of any completed versions of this form in their entirety. The rubric responses and section-level evaluations offer important context for understanding the final composite score. If individual board member evaluations were not retained, can you confirm if a final version with the averages by question is available? 

Thank you again for your time and attention to this request.

Best regards,
Sam Bellford

communications.communication:
Thank you for your request for public records made in accordance with the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (§ 2.2-3700 et seq.). Please be advised that pursuant to § 2.2-3704(A) of the Code of Virginia, “all public records shall be open to citizens of the Commonwealth, representatives of newspapers and magazines with circulation in the Commonwealth, and representatives of radio and television stations broadcasting in or into the Commonwealth during the regular office hours of the custodian of such records...The custodian may require the requester to provide his name and legal address.”

Therefore, unless you are associated with the media, please provide a legal Virginia address to show your residency. Please respond with this information to move forward with your FOIA request. The statutory timeline for the Virginia Department of Correction’s response is tolled until you respond with a legal Virginia address.

Sincerely,

Anne-Cabrié Forsythe
FOIA Officer
(804) 963-2953

communications.subject: Re: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia DOC transgender policies
communications.communication:
Hello Mr. Nash,

Thank you for your request for records made in accordance with the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (§ 2.2-3700 et seq.) received on June 25th. Please be advised that it is administratively impossible to provide the requested records or determine whether they are available within the five working days required by FOIA because of the scope of your request. Therefore, we are invoking § 2.2-3704(B)(4) of the Code of Virginia to provide us seven additional working days to respond to your request.
Best,

Riley O'Brien
Records Administrator
804-584-3420

title: Texas universities: Past and planned student events (University Of Texas At Tyler)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas universities: Past and planned student events (University Of Texas At Tyler)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a survey of events planned or proposed by recognized or registered student organizations (or individual students or faculty members). I am seeking copies of calendar entries for events that were held or proposed. I am not seeking a search of records held by students or student organizations. I am only seeking information held by the university administration (for example, in an Event Management System, which may be helpful in providing a list of past events and proposed future events). 

If this request is unclear or if I could clarify it in any way, please don't hesitate to ask.

I request:

1. All calendar entries (or Event Management System database entries) for events held or sponsored by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member during the final two weeks of each term during 2023, 2024, and Winter/Spring 2025. If your institution's academic calendar does not identify a final date of a given term, please use the final day of exams for the term as the final day of the term.

2. All calendar entries (or Event Management System database entries) for events held or sponsored by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member after 10:00 p.m. and/or before 8:00 a.m., between January 31, 2023 and July 1, 2025.

3. All calendar entries for events which are or were proposed to be held by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member, where the event is proposed to be held after 10:00 p.m. and/or before 8:00 a.m. This request is limited to events that are proposed to be held between July 1, 2025 and July 1, 2026. 

4. All calendar entries for events which are or were proposed to be held by a registered student organization, individual student, or faculty member, where the event is proposed to be during the final two weeks of a term in the Fall 2025, Winter 2025-2026, or Spring 2026 semesters/terms. Please us the same means of calculating "final two weeks" as in (1), above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Organized Retail Crime Task Force: Auror

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Organized Retail Crime Task Force: Auror
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the Organized Retail Crime Theft Task Force announced on June 23, 2022, specifically concerning the implementation, use, and discussion of Auror's crime intelligence platform.

1. All contracts, MOUs, RFPs, or service agreements between the AG's Office and Auror Inc. (auror.co) dated June 23, 2022, to present
1a. Amendments, scope-of-work documents, or SLA agreements related to Auror's services
1b. Invoices, payment receipts, or procurement documents for Auror software/services

2. Budget allocations specific to Auror platform implementation
2a. Documentation of federal/state grants used to fund Auror-related expenditures

3. Training manuals, guides, or protocols for Auror platform use by task force members
3a. Video recordings of Auror software training sessions
3b. Email communications regarding training schedules or materials

4. All incident reports, intelligence briefings, or case files generated through Auror's platform
4a. Spreadsheets/databases tracking organized retail crime incidents processed via Auror
4b. Performance metrics/reports evaluating Auror's effectiveness (2022-2024)

5. Records of technical malfunctions, data inaccuracies, or security breaches involving Auror
5a. Formal complaints from task force members or partner agencies about Auror's system
5b. Internal audits or third-party assessments of Auror's compliance with state data laws

6. Emails/memos between AG staff and Auror representatives (June 23, 2022-present)
6a. Meeting minutes where Auror platform use was discussed
6b. Correspondence with federal partners (FBI, DHS) regarding Auror data sharing

These records are requested from June 23, 2022, to present; Electronic copies are preferred in their original formats wherever possible, and commonly readable formats such as pdf, mp4, png where conversion is required.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robin Monks

communications.subject: Acknowledgement of Public Records Request - Monks - PRR-2025-0182
communications.communication:
Dear Robin Monks, This correspondence is to acknowledge your public records request received in our office on February 27, 2025. We assigned the file number above to your request. Please reference that number on any future correspondence regarding this request. You requested the following: Records related to the Organized Retail Crime Theft Task Force announced on June 23, 2022, specifically concerning the implementation, use, and discussion of Auror's crime intelligence platform. 
1. All contracts, MOUs, RFPs, or service agreements between the AG's Office and Auror Inc. (auror.co) dated June 23, 2022, to present 
1a. Amendments, scope-of-work documents, or SLA agreements related to Auror's services 
1b. Invoices, payment receipts, or procurement documents for Auror software/services 
2. Budget allocations specific to Auror platform implementation 
2a. Documentation of federal/state grants used to fund Auror-related expenditures 
3. Training manuals, guides, or protocols for Auror platform use by task force members 
3a. Video recordings of Auror software training sessions 
3b. Email communications regarding training schedules or materials 
4. All incident reports, intelligence briefings, or case files generated through Auror's platform 
4a. Spreadsheets/databases tracking organized retail crime incidents processed via Auror 
4b. Performance metrics/reports evaluating Auror's effectiveness (2022-2024) 
5. Records of technical malfunctions, data inaccuracies, or security breaches involving Auror 
5a. Formal complaints from task force members or partner agencies about Auror's system 
5b. Internal audits or third-party assessments of Auror's compliance with state data laws 
6. Emails/memos between AG staff and Auror representatives (June 23, 2022-present) 
6a. Meeting minutes where Auror platform use was discussed 
6b. Correspondence with federal partners (FBI, DHS) regarding Auror data sharing 
These records are requested from June 23, 2022, to present; Electronic copies are preferred in their original formats wherever possible, and commonly readable formats such as pdf, mp4, png where conversion is required. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. We are searching our records to determine the location, nature, and amount of records, if any, that may be responsive to your request. If responsive records are found, I estimate I can make available an installment of records on or before April 2, 2025. If records are ready prior to that time, I will notify you. If this time assessment requires adjustment, I will also advise you of that. Please contact me within 30 days via email or at Office of the Attorney General, Public Records & Constituent Services, P.O. Box 40100, Olympia, WA 98504-0100, if you have any questions. Thank you. 
 Kristin Young 
Kristin Young 
Senior Public Records Officer 
(360) 586-3568 
Kristin.Young@atg.wa.gov

communications.communication:
Dear Robin Monks, This correspondence is to update you on your public records request. You requested the following: Records related to the Organized Retail Crime Theft Task Force announced on June 23, 2022, specifically concerning the implementation, use, and discussion of Auror's crime intelligence platform. 
1. All contracts, MOUs, RFPs, or service agreements between the AG's Office and Auror Inc. (auror.co) dated June 23, 2022, to present

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. This email is to seek clarification of your request. Our request for clarification is as follows: Regarding section 4: 4. All incident reports, intelligence briefings, or case files generated through Auror's platform 
4a. Spreadsheets/databases tracking organized retail crime incidents processed via Auror 
4b. Performance metrics/reports evaluating Auror's effectiveness (2022-2024)” Clarification Question: When you ask for “incident reports” are you requesting the numerous individual reports written in Auror documenting each alleged criminal act that occurred at the retail establishment (e.g. each report when an individual stole something from a store)? Please let us know right away, but not later than June 9, 2025. If we do not hear from you by this date, we will begin producing records in installments as they come available. Please note that installments are provided free of charge via Box for inspection and/or download. You will not need a Box account to access the records. If you have any questions, please contact me via email or at Office of the Attorney General, Public Records & Constituent Services, P.O. Box 40100, Olympia, WA 98504-0100. Thank you. Sincerely, Kristin Young

communications.subject: PRR Time Estimate Update - Monks - PRR-2025-0182
communications.communication:
Dear Robin Monks, This correspondence is to update you on the status of your public records request. You requested the following: Records related to the Organized Retail Crime Theft Task Force announced on June 23, 2022, specifically concerning the implementation, use, and discussion of Auror's crime intelligence platform. 
1. All contracts, MOUs, RFPs, or service agreements between the AG's Office and Auror Inc. (auror.co) dated June 23, 2022, to present 
1a. Amendments, scope-of-work documents, or SLA agreements related to Auror's services 
1b. Invoices, payment receipts, or procurement documents for Auror software/services 
2. Budget allocations specific to Auror platform implementation 
2a. Documentation of federal/state grants used to fund Auror-related expenditures 
3. Training manuals, guides, or protocols for Auror platform use by task force members 
3a. Video recordings of Auror software training sessions 
3b. Email communications regarding training schedules or materials 
4. All incident reports, intelligence briefings, or case files generated through Auror's platform 
4a. Spreadsheets/databases tracking organized retail crime incidents processed via Auror 
4b. Performance metrics/reports evaluating Auror's effectiveness (2022-2024) 
5. Records of technical malfunctions, data inaccuracies, or security breaches involving Auror 
5a. Formal complaints from task force members or partner agencies about Auror's system 
5b. Internal audits or third-party assessments of Auror's compliance with state data laws 
6. Emails/memos between AG staff and Auror representatives (June 23, 2022-present) 
6a. Meeting minutes where Auror platform use was discussed 
6b. Correspondence with federal partners (FBI, DHS) regarding Auror data sharing 
These records are requested from June 23, 2022, to present; Electronic copies are preferred in their original formats wherever possible, and commonly readable formats such as pdf, mp4, png where conversion is required. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. We continue to search for these records and estimate it will take until June 10, 2025 to determine if we have responsive records. If records are ready prior to that time, we will notify you. If the responsive records are located additional time may be needed to gather and process them for release. We will send an extension letter if additional processing time is required. Please contact me within 30 days via email or at Office of the Attorney General, Public Records & Constituent Services, P.O. Box 40100, Olympia, WA 98504-0100, if you have any questions. Thank you. Sincerely, 
 Kristin Young 
Kristin Young 
Senior Public Records Officer

title: Federal government Rule 11 letters (Securities and Exchange Commission)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Federal government Rule 11 letters (Securities and Exchange Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. In any litigation before a federal district court on behalf of the United States or any agency, department, official, or employee thereof, any letter sent by your attorneys containing any of the following terms: 
a. "Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 11"
b. "Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, Rule 11"
c. "FRCP 11"
d. "Fed. R. Civ. P. 11"
e. "Fed. R. Civ. P., Rule 11"

2. Any policies, manuals, or guidance (not including guidance specific to a particular case) concerning pursuit of Rule 11 sanctions.

This request is limited to correspondence sent (or policies, manuals, or guidance utilized) on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: New Mexico IPRA Request: Police disciplinary files for officers/deputies in Thirteenth Judicial District

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico IPRA Request: Police disciplinary files for officers/deputies in Thirteenth Judicial District
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.

- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Bowling

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: New Mexico IPRA Request: Police disciplinary files for officers/deputies in Thirteenth Judicial District
communications.communication:
-----BY EMAIL ONLY-----

To:          Mr. Joshua Bowling
MuckRock News
              189420-25968973@requests.muckrock.com

Fr:          Melissa Howden
                Records Custodian 13th Judicial District Attorney of New Mexico

Re:         IPRA Request re Brady Giglio

Dear Mr. Bowling,

I, the undersigned am the Records Custodian for the 13th Judicial District Attorney of New Mexico. I received your request forwarded to me on 7/10/2025 for:


- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.

- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.


The 13th Judicial District does not maintain any lists, datasets or spread sheets detailing potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States. During the current administration of District Attorney Barbara Romo, we have had one Giglio disclosure letter and case re: former Officer Robert Turney in our Cibola County District. Included here is a document fragment detailing the underlying case. The allegation of misconduct came from a discovery from the district court; therefore, we don’t have specific additional records other than the attached letters to:

  *   The letter the Sheriff of Cibola County asked our deputy to draft and send.
  *   The spreadsheet detailing the cases for which we had to submit a disclosure letter.
  *   A copy of the disclosure letter.( Each letter heading was corrected for each case otherwise the body of the letter was the same, the letter attached is a sample).
  *   Letter to the Defense Counsel
Sincerely,


//Melissa Howden//


Melissa A. Howden
Chief Administrative Officer
13th Judicial District Attorney of New Mexico
711 Camino del Pueblo Sur
Post Office Box 1750
Bernalillo, NM 87004
505-771-7439 Office
505-269-4915 Mobile
https://www.13th.nmdas.com

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

An excel spreadsheet of the complaints filed against Safety National Casualty Corporation or Sedgwick Claims Management Services and a digital copy of any accusations or verified reports of bad faith or deceptive business practices since January 1st 2020; in additional any contracts or agreements with them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Fecteau

communications.subject: 25-FO-0749 RE: [External] Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Safety National Casualty Corporation / Sedgwick Claims Management Services Regulatory Action (Illinois Department Of Insurance)
communications.communication:
Good morning, Mr. Fectau,

Thank you for reaching out to our office.  As we work to process your request, we have identified three parts to your request:


  *   Part 1:  An excel spreadsheet of the complaints filed against Safety National Casualty Corporation or Sedgwick Claims Management Services
  *   Part 2: A digital copy of any accusations or verified reports of bad faith or deceptive business practices since January 1st 2020
  *   Part 3: Any contracts or agreements with them

Regarding Part 3, could you please clarify this request?  Are you seeking contracts or agreements between the Illinois Department of Insurance and the two companies you have identified?

Please respond to this email by July 2, 2025.

All the best,

Renee

title: Air Force Academy book search re: DEI Executive Order (United States Air Force Academy)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Air Force Academy book search re: DEI Executive Order (United States Air Force Academy)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The memo sent or signed by Gwendolyn DeFilippi concerning books in the library (or libraries) of the Air Force Academy, as described in an April 16, 2025, article published by the Associated Press and available here: https://apnews.com/article/dei-army-air-force-libraries-book-purge-c191f572cf62aa99a4dae9c259925626.

2. A copy of the interim list of books (which is due by April 30, 2025).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request: Body-Worn Camera Footage - Arrest of Matthew Leibach (February  14, 2023)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request: Body-Worn Camera Footage - Arrest of Matthew Leibach (February  14, 2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to Chapter 610 of the Missouri Revised Statutes, also known as the Missouri Sunshine Law, primarily deals with the public's right to access information from public governmental bodies in Missouri.

I respectfully request copies of all body-worn camera (BWC) footage related to the arrest of Matthew Leibach on or about February  14, 2023 at approximately 4:48 AM, by the St. Louis County Police.

Specifically, I am requesting:
All body-worn camera footage recorded by any St. Louis County Police Department personnel during the detention, investigation, or arrest of Matthew Leibach also footage of the vehicle chase that resulted in Matthew Leibach crashing the vehicle at Ohio Avenue and Broadway Street in St. Louis City.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brandon Martin

It is possible that some or all might not depict the specific footage you are requesting. Once reviewed and released, we will not complete any refunds. I am preparing an invoice for you now. communications.subject: [Invoice Created] St. Louis County public records request #25-7072
communications.communication:
St. Louis County ************************************************************************ An invoice has been created for record request #25-7072. Please pay by visiting Request #25-7072. We have researched your request and have a total of 4 hours and 26 minutes of body cam footage. This video footage includes 11 officer(s) that responded to the incident. The estimated fee for producing the requested records is as follows: * Video for All Officers: 4 hours and 46 minutes @ hourly rate 36.86 = $175.69. The total to process your request is $175.69. In accordance with Section 610.026.1(1) RSMo, the police department is requiring you to pay the estimated cost for the records you are seeking, prior to the records being reproduced for you. These fees are calculated on the best estimate of the actual cost of the research time to assemble and produce these records. Upon receipt of payment of the estimated cost, the records which are responsive to your request and are open records will be provided to you without undue delay. If for some reason I am unable to produce the open records within three business days after receipt of payment, I will provide an estimate on how long it will take. We accept cash, credit cards (excluding American Express), checks/ money orders (payable to the Treasurer of St. Louis County), or online payment through this system. By making an online payment on this request invoice, you agree to pay 2.9% of the payment amount plus $0.30. This fee goes to the payment gateway vendor, so St. Louis County receives only the invoiced amount. Please reference Next Request number (25-7072) on payment. Payment can be sent to the following address: St. Louis County Police Department Record Room Attn: Shannon Morgan 7900 Forsyth Blvd. Clayton, MO 63105 If payment is not received within 30 days, I will consider this request closed and you will then need to resubmit a new request. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at St. Louis County.

title: Public Records Request - Sebastian

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Sebastian
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sebastian Police Department,


I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:

https://www.sebastiandaily.com/crime/sebastian-woman-45-arrested-for-dui-kicking-cops-53901/



Exact address of incident: Sebastian Boulevard (CR-512)

Exact date of incident: 7th of August, 2023 around 11 p.m

Names of parties involved: Jennifer Brown



I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.


I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.


Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.



Best regards,

George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

Thank You,

Records Department

1201 Main Street

Sebastian,  FL  32958

(772) 589-5233

title: Stanely Sporkin (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Stanely Sporkin (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Stanley Sporkin (February 7, 1932 – March 23, 2020), who was a director of enforcement for the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), general counsel for the Central Intelligence Agency and United States federal judge of the United States District Court for the District of Columbia. This request includes, but is not limited to, any internally produced history studies which deal with Mr. Sporkin and his time as general counsel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] - RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Stanely Sporkin (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 106 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 785 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,695 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,088 days for processing.

Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
F: (540) 868-4391
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Sex Offender Registry and Information on Community Supervision
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The exact number of people who are 

1) on both the sex offender registry and probation; and
2) on both the sex offender registry and parole;

as per the latest available data is requested.

If this cannot be provided, I request records that include:

The list of people on probation
The list of people on parole
The list of people on the sex offender registry

as per the latest available data. 

If this data is held by another agency, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Oklahoma Open Records Request – February 10, 2025 High-Speed Pursuit and Arrest of Tyreese Ford
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

copies of all video and audio records related to the pursuit, crash, and arrest of Tyreese Ford on February 10, 2025, by the Oklahoma County Sheriff’s Office.

Please include:

All body-worn camera footage from deputies involved in the arrest

All dashcam/in-car video from vehicles involved in the pursuit

Helicopter or aerial footage, if applicable

911 calls, dispatch recordings, or radio traffic related to the pursuit and crash response

Footage capturing the Taser deployment and arrest at the crash site

Any available photos or video of the crash aftermath, including the damaged white car and pickup

Incident Details:

Date & Time: February 10, 2025

Suspect: Tyreese Ford

Location: Pursuit ended near SW 29th and Council Rd, Oklahoma City, OK

Chase Length: ~7 miles, reaching speeds up to 90 MPH

Events:

Ford fled with a female passenger

Sideswiped a vehicle during the pursuit

Crashed into a pickup at the intersection

Was tased and arrested on scene

Passenger was helped out of the car; airbags deployed

Ford had two active felony warrants related to burglaries

Please inform me of any applicable fees before processing. If any part of the requested records is withheld, I request that you release all non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory exemptions relied upon.

Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: RE: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Oklahoma Open Records Request – February 10, 2025 High-Speed Pursuit and Arrest of Tyreese Ford
communications.communication:

I wanted to follow up on the following Oklahoma Open Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on April 12, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Open Records Request: OCSO
communications.communication:
OCSO 202500233

Good morning!
I received your information from your Open Records request.
The cost of your Open Records request is $15.99, which includes certified mailing. Please see the attached invoice.
Please forward your business check or money order (sorry, no personal checks), payable to the Oklahoma County Sheriff's Office, to:
Oklahoma County Sheriff’s Office
Attn: Finance Division/Debi Shaw
2101 Northeast 36th Street
Oklahoma City, OK  73111
Your request will be fulfilled and mailed to you when payment is received.
Please feel free to contact me directly if you have any questions.

Debi Shaw
Specialist
Criminal Investigations Division
Oklahoma County Sheriff's Office
2101 Northeast 36th Street
Oklahoma City, OK  73111​

communications.subject: FW: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request #OCSO 202500233
communications.communication:
Greetings.
I received your email that states that your payment is being processed and mailed. However, the address you listed is for the Oklahoma County Detention Center and not the Oklahoma County Sheriff’s Office.
Please do not send your payment to 201 N Shartel Oklahoma City, as we are not associated the detention center.
Please see my previous email which has our agency’s mailing address.
Please call me if you have any questions.
Thank you!

Debi Shaw
Specialist
Criminal Investigations Division
Oklahoma County Sheriff's Office
2101 Northeast 36th Street
Oklahoma City, OK  73111​

files.title: image001
files.source: Oklahoma County Sheriff, Oklahoma County, OK

communications.subject: RE: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request #OCSO 202500233
communications.communication:
Hello, 

Thank you for the info about the correct address! Apologies for the confusion.

We'll go ahead and process a replacement check for the same amount to be sent to 2101 Northeast 36th Street. We kindly ask that you/the detention center return or void the check sent to 201 N Shartel Ave upon receipt. 

Thank you for your continued help with this request.

title: Holocaust Survey (Connetquot Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Holocaust Survey (Connetquot Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

By way of background, on August 10, 2022, Governor Kathy Hochul signed into law Chapter 490 of the Laws of 2022 requiring a survey regarding instruction on the Holocaust within New York State public school districts. Through the survey, superintendents are required to attest that the district is teaching about the Holocaust appropriately as part of classroom instruction aligned with the NYS Social Studies Learning Standards and §801 of Education Law.

In October 2022, Deputy Commissioner Angelique Johnson-Dingle sent a memo to public school superintendents including a copy of that survey and instructions for accessing and submitting the survey via the SED Monitoring and Vendor Performance System in the NYSED Business Portal.

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request all of the Holocaust Instruction Survey responses submitted since August 10, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Communications: ICE/DHS

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Communications: ICE/DHS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm reaching out because this school was recently included on a list of 60 schools that received letters from the Dept. of Education saying they were under investigation for "Antisemitic Discrimination and Harassment."
Source: https://www.ed.gov/about/news/press-release/us-department-of-educations-office-civil-rights-sends-letters-60-universities-under-investigation-antisemitic-discrimination-and-harassment
Also, recently, two students and counting from Columbia University (which is on this list) have been arrested by immigration authorities.
Source: https://apnews.com/article/columbia-university-mahmoud-khalil-ice-arrests-3a8db6e646b786a721089a6f0bc8d9fc

Therefore, pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records (from January 20, 2025 to the time that this request is processed):
1) Any emails between members of your institution's police department/safety office and anyone with the email domain "@ice.dhs.gov" or "@whitehouse.gov" or "@dhs.gov"
2) Any emails between members of your institution's office of the president and anyone with the email domain "@ice.dhs.gov" or "@whitehouse.gov" or "@dhs.gov"
3) Any emails between members of your institution's department of student housing/on-campus living and anyone with the email domain "@ice.dhs.gov" or "@whitehouse.gov" or "@dhs.gov"

I am a reporter for WIRED filing this request in pursuit of a time-sensitive news story; therefore, I ask that my request is expedited.  Also, as a reporter for WIRED, the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request. 

When completing this request, please prioritize whichever records would take the least amount of time to be located and released.  Also, I would like these records in electronic format, sent via email or other digital method. Also, if you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so, whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

If there are any questions about my request, or I can provide any clarification that will help expedite the processing of my request, please contact me here. I am also happy to hop on the phone. Thanks again, and I look forward to your reply within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires, as the statute requires, and even sooner if possible.

Best,
Caroline Haskins

Sincerely,

Colleen O'Dea

title: FOIA Request - Fayette County Opioid Settlement Funds

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request - Fayette County Opioid Settlement Funds
communications.communication:
Ruth Lanier, County Administrator 
Fayette County Commission
100 N Court Street 
Fayetteville, WV 25840

Dear Ruth Lanier, 

Pursuant to the state open records law W.Va. Code Secs. 29B-1-1 to 29B-1-7, I write to request access to public records regarding Fayette County’s opioid settlement funds. Specifically, I am requesting copies of: 
the amount of funds Fayette County has received so far
the application to apply for funding
the individuals who will review the funding applications
the process by which funds will be awarded
documents or other information detailing how the opioid settlement funds distributed to Fayette County have been awarded through March 1, 2025, if at all, including budgets, grant allocations, and expenditure reports.
any existing or proposed plans outlining future use of said opioid settlement funds, including strategic plans, meeting minutes in which county-level officials participated, and correspondence and attachments regarding funding allocations.
any public reports, audits, or documentation created by the county regarding the accountability and impact of these funds
All attachments, addendums, appendices, exhibits, and other related documents that were included as part of the contracts.

If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address.
As provided by the open records law, I will expect your response within five (5) working days. See W. Va. Code Sec. 29B-1-3(d).
If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.
I would note that willful violation of the open records law is a misdemeanor, punishable by a fine of not less than $200 nor more than $1,000, or imprisonment in the county jail for twenty (20) days, or both. See W. Va. Code Sec. 29B-1-6. Court costs and attorney fees may also be awarded. See Sec. 29B-1-7.
Thank you for your assistance.
Thank you for considering my request.

Sincerely,
Aidan Cornue
(312) 458-5125
amc00069@mix.wvu.edu

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Division of Corrections)

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Division of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

communications.subject: RE: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Division of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern: 

Thank you for your response regarding my records request.

I understand that certain employment-related records may be exempt from disclosure under W. Va. Code §29B-1-4(a)(2), and I appreciate you taking the time to review the request.

If possible, I’d like to ask whether there is a staff member within the Division of Corrections and Rehabilitation responsible for overseeing or coordinating mental health programming across West Virginia facilities. I am not requesting confidential personnel records — only the name and work contact information of a relevant point of contact.

We are reaching out regarding a free, volunteer-led meditation program designed to support emotional regulation and well-being for incarcerated individuals, and would be grateful for any guidance on whom to contact to explore this offering further.

Thank you again for your time and consideration.

Warm regards,
Andrew Ma

title: SOR and Community Supervision

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: SOR and Community Supervision
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking data to understand offenders who have double forms of community supervision (i.e. parole and sex offender registry (SOR)). Iowa Department of Corrections had helped to provide a list of all offenders on probation and parole. I would like to be able to cross reference that list with the current Iowa SOR to pull the data I am seeking. I would like to request that the Division provide the list of offenders on the SOR currently. 

If that request is not possible, I wonder if the Division has: the exact number of people who are 1) on both the sex offender registry and probation; and 2) on both the sex offender registry and parole; as per the latest available data is requested.

If another agency has this data, I request the name of that agency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

communications.subject: Re: ** External Email Alert **  Iowa Open Records Law Request: SOR and Community Supervision
communications.communication:

After consulting with the Sex Offender Registry staff, I have the following information to provide:

information about all SOR registrants can be found on our website - https://iowasexoffender.gov/
